messageBody:

JUnit-addons Runner enables you to ignore a test "on the fly" by
throwing an IgnoredException (or something like that). The test will be
executed but reported as "ignored".

This would take care of problem #2.

public void testXYZ() {
if (!shouldRun()) {
throw new IngoredException();
}
}

-Vladimir
